etymology.description: Originally composed of 疒(疒) (nè, "sickness") + 發(發) (fā, "hair") = Related to 发(bá, "to send") sound -> serves as a phonetic element in compound characters
etymology.interpretation: The character 癹(bá) is primarily used as a phonetic component in other characters, contributing the 'bá' sound without a fixed meaning on its own.

examples.chinese: 这个字利用癹传音(這個字利用癹傳音)，帮助识记发音(幫助識記發音)。
examples.pinyin: zhège zì lìyòng bá chuányīn, bāngzhù shíjì fāyīn.
examples.english: This character uses bá as a phonetic component to help memorize its pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 在一些复合字中(在一些複合字中)，癹充当声旁(癹充當聲旁)。
examples.pinyin: zài yīxiē fùhézì zhōng, bá chōngdāng shēngpáng.
examples.english: In some compound characters, bá serves as the phonetic part.

examples.chinese: 在古文献中(在古文獻中)，癹被用来表音(癹被用來表音)。
examples.pinyin: zài gǔwénxiàn zhōng, bá bèi yòng lái biǎoyīn.
examples.english: In ancient texts, bá was used to indicate pronunciation.
